channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DHS blasts Chicago mayor for comparing raid leader to segregationists, accusing him of 'terror'

item.title: It’s Impossible To Keep Up With The Fall Of Britain
item.description: The United Kingdom is now in a rolling crisis that its leaders can neither manage nor control. We should pay attention.

item.description: Del Toro’s remake refuses to grow up.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says the secret to climbing the corporate ladder flows through this department—and Tim Cook is proof it works
item.description: The secret to CEO success isn’t knowing how to code or use AI chatbots—it’s mastering the supply chain, according to Ford’s Jim Farley.

item.title: As Gen Z question the values of higher ed, CEO at this nearly $1 billion company says it’s ‘silly’ to think one degree will be enough education for life
item.description: Udemy CEO Hugo Sarrazin says the degrees vs. skills debate should be focused on “cohabitation.”

item.title: Ex-Rep. Elaine Luria announces candidacy for her former House seat in Virginia
item.description: Former Rep. Elaine Luria, who lost reelection in 2022, is launching a comeback bid for her old congressional seat in Virginia.

item.title: Democrats’ Favorite Talking Point About Children And Gun Deaths Is A Lie
item.description: Gun control advocates often claim that guns are the leading cause of death among children — but that is false.

item.description: California state Sen. Scott Wiener had a message for women fearful of males in their locker rooms: Trans women are women.

item.title: Gen Z isn’t doom spending. Wasting money on flashy purchases is normal while you’re young and have nothing else to be admired for yet, expert says
item.description: “My aspiration for material stuff is the inverse of what else I have to offer the world,” The Psychology of Money author said.

item.description: Young people are obsessed with Kim K's shapewear line. Nearly 70% of Skims' customers are Gen Z or millennials.

item.description: A 50-year mortgage, an eight-year car loan, and a forever college payment. Is this the best we can do for our young people?
